45454AC613644113B45DE6D399A75CF7.description: Demonstrate competency of scaling, measuring, weighing ingredients with a portion scale.

C07C379C012542F9AFD8F79B4488FBE7.description: Perform basic math functions to include fractions, weights and measurements.

079AD0F05E014AC8AB74B09D0F615BD5.description: Review and apply the laws and rules of the regulatory agencies governing sanitation and safety in a foodservice operation.

8B6B3BF9DF7B4F86AFCE13859AF1410E.description: Describe appropriate types and use of fire extinguishers used in the foodservice area.

9CBFFD6CFA354320860FA4882495944F.description: Describe appropriate measures for insects, rodents and pest control eradication.

28C7BD7B8CA241BF8BE48734D78E84FD.description: Demonstrate appropriate emergency policies for kitchen and dining room injuries.

407551E7577F43A1A85280569F0767C8.description: Identify proper methods of waste disposal and recycling.

7FF807A669884EBF86E5C408329A921B.description: Review Safety Data Sheets (SDS) and explain their requirements in handling hazardous materials. Discuss right-to-know laws.

11AE695398A14AD4B08CE42EF0610744.description: Recognize sanitary and safety design and construction features of food production equipment and facilities. (i.e., NSF, UL, OSHA ADA, etc.).

6AA9F0A374E94260AE717CA78EB2895D.description: List the major reasons for and recognize signs of food spoilage and contamination.

A079214EF2404844A7B8EB92343C90F6.description: Identify the Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HAACP) during all food handling processes as a method for minimizing the risk of food borne illness.

79980633627B46539C81FCAF0EC4BC86.description: Outline the requirements for proper receiving and storage of both raw and prepared foods.

625ACAE94DA0407293E85E0C0B537B79.description: Demonstrate good personal hygiene and health habits in a laboratory setting to include hand washing.

1BB77236C8D8442C94B3F0155B886C49.description: Demonstrate acceptable procedures when preparing potentially hazardous foods to include time/temperature principles.

02583151E7BF4B50B8962ACB565B1AA8.description: Identify microorganisms, which are related to food spoilage and food-borne illnesses; describe their requirements and methods for growth.

8E72C8AB92914096AEAEE37E376FC613.description: Discuss and evaluate industry trade periodicals, books, and journals that can contribute to individual growth and learning as they pertain to technical skills.

2F1E867737464DBFABADC3099F66BD69.description: Discuss/evaluate industry trends as they relate to the various segments of the foodservice and hospitality industry.

35654D7DA5E1481EB22AA0F6B0BDF745.description: Evaluate the types of professional career opportunities in the hospitality and foodservice industry with support of guest speakers, field trips and stages.

D8DB25C572B34D53926B99FF57DD8077.description: Identify and describe professional organizations associated with the hospitality and foodservice profession, and discuss these organizations' roles in preparing and advancing one's career in the industry.

29CA65057E9D4749B6BEAE9BAF20C807.description: Outline the organization, structure and functional areas in various hospitality organizations as they pertain to the functions of menu planning, purchasing, food production and service, food and beverage controls, management, etc. and give a short description for each.

A2FF83E1690E444F98B3F2980F707A7A.description: Trace the growth and development of the hospitality and tourism industry from its birth to its present day. Include names of restauranteurs, chefs, and hospitality entrepreneurs that helped to shape our industry in the past and present day.
